intro: Cyclophorus cornutus, commonly known as the horned cyclophorus, is a unique species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive horn-like structures on its stem, which are believed to play a role in its ecological interactions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Cyclophorus cornutus is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
